revised_title: The Influence of Substrate and Enzyme Concentrations on the Optimum Temperature of Salicin Hydrolysis
tldr: The author investigates the effect of substrate and enzyme concentrations on the optimum temperature for salicin hydrolysis by sweet-almond emulsin. They find that the optimum temperature remains constant, regardless of the substrate and enzyme concentrations. This study contributes to understanding enzyme kinetics and the factors affecting enzyme activity.
